title: SYLOSIS Guitarist ALEX BAILEY Quits The Band After 16 Years
description: They've got a replacement lined up.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 8 hours ago
excerpt: They've got a replacement lined up.
text: Sylosis and longtime guitarist Alex Bailey have parted ways. Sylosis notes that Bailey has already launched a new band called Cosen, and that they'll carry on with former live guitarist Ben Thomas. "Sadly, we have to announce that our guitarist, Bailey, will be stepping down from the band due to not being able to commit to our upcoming touring schedule. We want to express our gratitude for his years of dedication to Sylosis and the great memories we've shared," wrote Sylosis. "Bailey is one of the hardest working, most loyal and amazingly talented band mates we could have ever asked for. We still remain close friends! "Bailey also has a new musical project, COSEN, who we urge you to keep an eye out for. He will be joining us onstage at our upcoming London show with Fit For An Autopsy. You will be missed Bailey! "We're excited to welcome our good friend, Ben Thomas, to the band. Some of you may remember him from our tour with Malevolence last year. Please give him a warm welcome! Bailey issued his own statement as well, saying: "After 16 awesome years of riffing around the globe, the time has come for me to step down from Sylosis. The balancing act of touring with business commitments and a young family is no easy task. I've forged lifelong friendships, created unforgettable memories, and lived out my childhood dreams. I want to extend a heartfelt thank you to everyone who has supported the band and me over the years. You might catch me for the occasional show appearance, but until then… keep shredding!" Sylosis has a LOT of tour dates coming up. html:
Sylosis and longtime guitarist Alex Bailey have parted ways. Sylosis notes that Bailey has already launched a new band called Cosen, and that they'll carry on with former live guitarist Ben Thomas.

"Sadly, we have to announce that our guitarist, Bailey, will be stepping down from the band due to not being able to commit to our upcoming touring schedule. We want to express our gratitude for his years of dedication to Sylosis and the great memories we've shared," wrote Sylosis.

"Bailey is one of the hardest working, most loyal and amazingly talented band mates we could have ever asked for. We still remain close friends!

"Bailey also has a new musical project, COSEN, who we urge you to keep an eye out for. He will be joining us onstage at our upcoming London show with Fit For An Autopsy. You will be missed Bailey!

"We're excited to welcome our good friend, Ben Thomas, to the band. Some of you may remember him from our tour with Malevolence last year. Please give him a warm welcome!

Bailey issued his own statement as well, saying: "After 16 awesome years of riffing around the globe, the time has come for me to step down from Sylosis. The balancing act of touring with business commitments and a young family is no easy task. I've forged lifelong friendships, created unforgettable memories, and lived out my childhood dreams. I want to extend a heartfelt thank you to everyone who has supported the band and me over the years. You might catch me for the occasional show appearance, but until then… keep shredding!"
